question: Supernumerary teeth common location -
exp: Supernumerary teeth are those which are additional or in excess of the normal number. The most common site is upper incisor. Ref: K. S. Narayan Reddy's synopsis of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology 29 th edition Chapter 4, page- 59.

question: Cephalic index 75- 80 is seen in
exp: Cephalic index 1. Dolicocephalic ( long headed) 70-75 2. Mesaticephalic(medium headed) 75- 80 3. Brachycephalic( sho headed) 80-85 Present study aimed at working outcephalic index in Indian students. 100 students were taken as subjects and head length, head breadth were measured. Indian males had meancephalic index of 77. 92 and they were mesocephalic and females had mean cephalic index of 80. 85 and they were brachycephalic. Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS PAGE NO 67

question: Commonly used long bone for identification -
exp: The best long bone for identification is femur. Ref: K. S. Narayan Reddy's synopsis of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology 29 th edition Chapter 4 page, 43, 45.

question: In a female, basi-occiput fuses with basi-sphenoid at the age of
exp: Basal suture: the basiocciput fuses with basisphenoid by about 18- 22 years in females and 19- 24 years in males. Metopic suture: closes from 2-8 years. In some cases, the metopic suture will not close and may be associated with other congenital anomalies like hydrocephalus and meningocele with asymmetry of fingers which is called Metopic syndrome. Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr. PC IGNATIUS PAGE NO: 86

question: Best bone of the following to assess the age of a person between 20-50 years is
exp: Age changes at pubic symphysis The changes in the pubic symphysis are the best criteria to assess the age from third to fifth decade. The changes occurs on three components: dorsal surface, ventral surface, and margin. At the age of about 20 years, there is formation of horizontal ridges of bone on the aicular surface which first stas on the upper poion of the ventral surface and extends to the dorsal surface. This is called billowing. At about 25-35 years, the surface becomes granular and the ventral nd dorsal margins are well defined. A rim formation stas from the dorsal surface extends to the ventral surface. At about 35 -45 years, the upper and lower end will be raised and also the ventral margin by bony extension which is called lipping and the beaded rim development will be complete on all around the margins of the aicular surface. By 45-55 years, the beaded rim stas breaking. By 55-65 years the breakdown of the rim is more and by the end of seventh decade the breakdown of the rim will be complete. Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr. PC IGNATIUS PAGE NO90

question: Which of the following teeth erupt earlier in the upper jaw-
exp: Eruption usually occurs in lower jaw first except it is preceded by lateral incisors in upper jaw. ref: Dr. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 35..

question: Rugoscopy is -
exp: Rugoscopy or palatoprints are study of structural details such as rugae in anterior pa of palate which is individualistic and specific as fingerprints ref:. Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 48.

question: Fluorescent feulgen reaction is used to demonstrate
exp: The X chromosome is seen as a Plano convex mass lying inside the nucleus just beneath the nuclear membrane as a nucleolar satellite, in the cells of buccal mucosa. This is called Barr body. Barr bodies are seen in the somatic cells of normal females (XX) Barr bodies can be demonstrated by eosin- hematoxylin staining or fluorescent Feulgen reaction technique using Acriflavine Schiff reagent for X chromosome which is seen as a bright yellow spot. Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE 70

question: Pearson's formula is used for -
exp: STATURE * The most common method used- linear regression. * With this technique, the known statures of adults in a given population are plotted against the lengths of skeletal elements and the best lines are fitted to the scatter plots * Various regression formulae for calculating height have been compiled, based on a number of different populations and sex. * Karl pearson&; s formula: a constant factor is to be added to the product of the length of the bone with the multiplying factor * femur- (Males) 81. 306 +1. 880 x length of femur, (072. 884+1. 945 x length * Tibia -- (M)78. 664 + 2. 376 x length, (F) 74. 774 +2. 352 X length * Humerus -- 70. 641+2. 891 x length, (F)71. 745+ 2. 754 x length Ref: P. C. Ignsitus Textbook of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology, 3rd edition, Page 96.

question: Which of the following teeth erupt earlier in upper jaw
exp: Permanent teeth will erupt between 6 years and 17-25 years. First permanent tooth to erupt is the first molar by 6-7 years. Total 32 numbers; 4 incisors, 2 canines, 4 premolars and 6 molars in each jaw and their periods are shown: First molar 6-7 years. Medial incisors 7-8 years Lateral incisors 8-9 years First premolar 9-10 years Second premolar 10-11 years Canines 11-12 years Second molar 12-14 years Third molar 17-25 years All deciduous and permanent teeth will erupt first in the lower jaw except lateral incisors Ref: K. S. Narayan Reddy's Synopsis of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology, 29th edition, Chapter 4, page-40, 41.

question: Which of the following is proof of eyes being open for a few hours after death
exp: Tache noire: Cornea and conjunctiva will become dry on the exposed poion of the eye ball with deposition of cellular debris and dust. This is called Tache Noire Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE NO 30

question: Study of finger printing is -
exp: Study of fingerprint is also known as dermatoglyphics or galtons system. Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 47.

question: Locord's systems is -
exp: Poroscopy or Locards system is study of pores of sweat glands on the epidermal ridges at fingeips. Each mm of ridge contains 9-15 pores. It is useful when fragments of fingerprints are available. ref: Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 47.

question: First secondary ossification center appears in -
exp: Ossification centre appears in lower end of femur in 36 weeks. Dr. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 46.

question: Palatoprints for identification of the person is performed by taking prints from which area of the hard plate -
exp: Palatogram is study of rugae in anterior pa of hard palate. It is highly specific as fingerprints ref:. Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 48

question: Best specimen of bone for sex determination is -
exp: According to Krogman, the degree of accuracy in sexing adult skull remains is: Entire skeleton 100% Pelvis alone 95% Skull alone 90% Pelvis plus skull 98% Long bones alone 80% Dr. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 30.

question: Ossification centre Calcaneum appears in
exp: Ossification centres Foot calcaneum: 5 months of JULY Talus: 7 months Cuboid: 9 months Navicular: 1 year Cuneiforms: 1 to3 years Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE 92

question: Chaing of left lower canine is A/E -
exp: Chaing of left lower canine is 22 in palmar notation. Ref: K. S Narayan Reddy's synopsis of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology 29 th edition, Chapter 4 page no -60

question: Period of mixed dentition is
exp: Period of mixed dentition: stas from the eruption of first molar. It is usually 6-11 years and may extend to 12-13 years. Thus, Number of teeth by 2-6 years: 20 temporary Number of teeth at 7 years is 24 teeth: 4 permanent and 20 temporary teeth At the age of 10 years, 16 permanent teeth and 8 temporary teeth. At 11 years, 20 permanent teeth and 4 temporary teeth. Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS PAGE NO 80

question: Which of the following bones is the most accurate sex determination
exp: The whole pelvis is the most reliable bone for sex determination Krogmans degree of accuracy in sex determination from adult skeleton remains *Entire skeleton -100 percent *pelvis alone -95 percent *skull alone -90 percent *pelvis plus skull -98 percent *long bones alone -80 to 90 percent *long bones and skull -90 to 95 percnt *long bones and pelvis -Greater than 95 percent Knights Forensic Pathology 4th edition page number 106

question: Species identifications are done by
exp: Tests for species identification are Precipitin test, Latex agglutination test, Haem-agglutination inhibition test Ref: Krishan Vij textbook of forensic medicine, 5th edition pg: 54

question: Two identical twins will not have same -
exp: There is one chance in 64000 millions of two persons having same fingerprints. It is always unique for each person. ref: Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 47.

question: Multiplication factor of finding height from length of foot is
exp: Height of individual can be calculated from the length of foot print Height = length of foot print x 7 Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE 100

question: A dead body is found to have mark like "branching of tree in front of chest. The most likely cause of death is
exp: Burns from lightning may appear in the form of 'arborescent markings' on the surface of the skin, looking like branches of a tree. Ref: Textbook of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology; 5th ed; Page no: 161

question: Corpus delicti stands for -
exp: Corpus delicti (Latin: corpus-main body or mass of the structure, delictus - offence or fault) means the essence of crime or the body of offence. It includes facts and elements of a criminal offence for example murder, road traffic accident, place of suicide etc. The main pa of corpus delicti is the establishment of the identity of the dead body, and infliction of violence in a paicular way, at a paicular time and place, by the person or persons charged with a crime and none other. Ref: Dr K. S Narayana Reddy, The Essentials of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology, 34th edition, 2017, pg. 55.

question: Most reliable method of identification of a person is -
exp: Dactylography is study of fingerprint patterns. It is also known as Galton system or dermatoglyphics. It is considered the most reliable method for identification as these patterns are not inherited and remain permanent and distinctive for each person. ref: Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 47.

question: Number of milk teeth -
exp: Temporary, deciduous or milky teeth are 20 in number, 4 incisors, 2 canines and 4 molars in each jaw. ref: Dr. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 35.

question: Super imposition technique is used in -
exp: Skull and photo superimposition is used in identification. Nasion, menton, gonion, prosthion, nasal spine, zygoma, supraorbital ridge, EA meatus, angle of jaw and teeth are compared in life size negatives of the persons skull and photo ref:. Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 48.

question: A police officer brings the aboed product of conception of size 2 cm and weight 10 gm. For forensic purpose what will be the age of the fetus?
exp: According to rule of Hasse, the age of fetus is 6 weeks. RULE OF HAASE It is a rough method of calculating the age of fetus. The length of fetus is measured from crown to heel in centimeters. During first five months of pregnancy- square root of length gives approximate age of fetus in months. During last five months- length in centimeters divided by 5 gives age in months. - MORISON&; s law ref: Dr. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 46.

question: According to F. D. I formula, the tooth that is denoted by the number 34 is
exp: Each tooth is numbered by the quadrant (1 to 4) and by the tooth within the quadrant (1 to 8) 1 Maxillary right 2 Maxillary left 3 Mandibular left 4 Mandibular right Tooth Numbers Within Each Quadrant: Sta with number 1 at the midline (central incisor) to number 8, third molar so 34 is left lower, 4th tooth (first premolar) Ref - https://en. m. wikipedia. org/wiki/FDI_World_Dental_Federation_notation

question: Faint letter marks can be made visible using
exp: Tattoo marks Tattoo marks are designs made on the skin by multiple punctures with needles dipped in coloring agents. The designs are permanent because the coloring material goes under the epidermis and stain the dermis. Dyes commonly used are indigo, cobalt, carbon, Vermilion, Prussian blue, and Indian ink. The tattoo marks are permanent and persists for many years. After 8 to 10 years it may fade and a faded tattoo can be made visible by ultraviolet lamp or infrared photography. Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE NO 101

question: The most reliable criteria in Gustafson method of age estimation is -
exp: The canals in dentin become wide and are filled with mineral so that they become translucent gradually. It is not seen until thiy years of age. It is the most reliable criteria in Gustafsons method. Ref: Dr. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 37.

question: Pearson formula is used for calculating
exp: karl Pearson formula for reconstruction of stature from dried long bones. Male female Stature 81. 306 + 1. 880F 72. 884 + 1. 945F Stature 70. 641 + 2. 894H 71. 475 + 2. 754 H Stature 78. 664 + 2. 376T 74. 774 + 2. 353T Stature 89. 925 + 3. 271R 81. 224 + 3. 343R F is femur, H is humerus, T is tibia, R is radius. The measurements are in centimeters. Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE NO 96

question: Length of tibia is -
exp: Length of tibia is 20% of total height. Ref: K. S. Narayan Reddy's Synopsis of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology, 29th edition, Chapter 4, page-51.

question: The best way for identification of a person is
exp: Dactylography or Galton system Fingerprints are impressions of patterns formed by the papillary ridges of fingers. In modern times, fingerprints stand as the unique identification data. Fingerprints match is widely accepted as the most reliable evidence of identification. The possibility of another person having the same fingerprints is one in 64 thousand million. i. e. three times the population of the world. Even in identical twins, the fingerprint will be different. Fingerprints do not change throughout life unless damage has occurred to the dermal skin layer. Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE NO 97

question: According to 2000 act, juvenile is boy and girl respectively less than -
exp: According to Juvenile Justice Act 2000, a juvenile is a girl or boy who has not completed 18 years of age. Juvenile in conflict with law is a juvenile alleged to have committed an offence and not completed 18 years of age at time of commission of offence. Such persons should be sent to Juvenile Home and never imprisoned or sentenced to death. Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 44.

question: Majority is obtained by a person under cou guardianship by age of -
exp: A person under a guardian appointed by the Cou attains majority at age of 21 years whereas a person normally attains majority at age of 18 years. ref: Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 45.

question: The fingerprint pattern may be impaired permanently in cases of
exp: Fingerprints are usually lost in leprosy, electric injury and after exposure to radiation. It cannot be removed by wounds or burns. It may also produce additional characteristics. Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 48.

question: A hair is found at crime and you are asked to evaluate whether it is human. Which of the following attributes indicates that the hair will be of human origin
exp: The cuticle completely covers the hair shaft in human hair. It paly covers the hair shaft in animal hair Human hair has three pas Cuticle -outer layer Coex-middle layer Medulla - inner layer
opb: Pigment granules present in coex and medulla

question: Crural Index is -
exp: Crural index is length of tibia/ femur x 100. It is impoant for determination of race. ref: k narayana reddy forensic medicine

question: Identical twins can be differentiated by
exp: * Among twins, the DNA fingerprint will show same pattern * But the fingerprint pattern is different even in identical twins. * The Fingerprint patterns are not inherited and paternity cannot be proved through fingerprint patterns. * The fingerprint patterns are distinctive and permanent in individuals. Ref:- Essentials of Forensic medicine Dr KS narayana Reddy 33th Edition; Pg num:- 86

question: Pre-auricular sulcus helps in detection of which of the following
exp: Preauricular sulcus is present in pelvis. It is used to determine the sex of an individual. It is not frequent narrow shallow in males. It is more frequent broad and deep in females. REF: The Synopsis of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology 29th edition by Dr N. S. Narayan Reddy page no: 36.

question: Pure Aryans have which type of skull
exp: Type of skull cephalic index race Dolicocephalic 70-75 Aryans, aborigines and Negroes Mesaticephalic 75- 80 Europeans and Indians Brachycephalic 80-85 Mongolians Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE NO 67

question: Cheiloscopy is the study of prints of -
exp: Cheiloscopy is study of lipprints which are divided into 8 patterns. The fissures and grooves are characteristic for an individual. There are 24 characteristics. If 7 to 9 characters tally identification is established. Cheiloscopy is derived from Greek words cheilos -- lips and eskopein - see Lips are unique to one person, except in monozygotic twins Lip grooves are permanent and unchangeable It is possible to identify lip patterns as early as the sixth week of intrauterine life Resist many afflictions, such as herpetic lesions Pathologies that damage the lip subtract like burns seem to rule out cheiloscopy Dr. K. S. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27th edition pg. 48.

question: Permanent erasure of fingerprint is seen following
exp: Dactylography or Galton system Fingerprints are impressions of patterns formed by the papillary ridges of fingers. Fingerprints do not change throughout life unless damage has occurred to the dermal skin layer. Permanent impairement of fingerprints occur in leprosy, electrical injury, after exposure to radiation, and in dyskeratosis congenita. A very rare medical condition is adermetoglyphia, in which there is absence of finger prints, with no other medical signs or symptoms. Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE NO: 97

question: Which is the first permanent tooth to erupt
exp: Period of eruption of permanent teeth First molar 6-7 years Medial incisors 7-8 years Lateral incisors 8-9 years First premolar 9-10 years Second premolar 10-11 years Canines 11-12 years Second molar 12-14 years Third molar 17-25 years Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr. PC IGNATIUS PAGE NO 70

question: Edgeoscopy refers to
exp: Edgeoscopy -evaluation of fingerprint Dactylography-evaluation of fingerprints Ridgeology-evaluation of friction ridges on fingerprints Poroscopy-evaluation of sweat pores openings on fingerprint ridges Cheiloscopy-evaluation of lip prints Podography - evaluation of foot prints Rugoscopy-evaluation of palatal Refernce: Encyclopedia of Forensic Medicine and legal medicine PG no 9, vol 3
opb: Evaluation of edges of lip print
opc: Evaluation of edges of foot print

question: According to the universal system, the tooth that is denoted by the number 23 is
exp: The tooth designated "1" is the maxillary right third molar and the count continues along the upper teeth to the left side. Then the count begins at the mandibular left third molar, designated number 17, and continues along the bottom teeth to the right side Ref - https://en. m. wikipedia. org/wiki/FDI_World_Dental_Federation_notation

question: Multiplication factor for estimating height from length of foot is
exp: (Length of one upper limb x 2) +34 is equal to stature. Height of head x 8 is equal to stature Length from veex to pubis x 2 is equal to height Length of foot x 7 is the approximate height Suprasternal notch to pubic symphysis x 3. 3 is equal to stature. Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE NO 96

question: Legal age of consent is -
exp: legal age for consent in india 18 yrs Sec 89 IPC. Act done in good faith for benefit of child or insane person, by or by consent of guardian.--Nothing which is done in good faith for the benefit of a person under twelve years of age, or of unsound mind, by or by consent, either express or implied, of the guardian or other person having lawful charge of that person, is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause, or be intended by the doer to cause or be known by the doer to be likely to cause to that person. Ref: K. S. Narayan Reddy&; s synopsis of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology, 29 th edition, Chapter 4 page 30.

question: Pelvic brim in males -
exp: PELVIC BRIM OR INLET: It is heart shaped in males It is circular or elliptical more spacious diameters longer in females. REF: The Synopsis of Forensic Medicine by Dr K. S. Narayan Reddy 29th edition page no: 37.

question: Pre-auricular sulcus helps in detection of -
exp: Pre auricular sulcus is more frequent, broad and deep in female pelvis as compared to male. ref: Dr. Narayana Reddys Synopsis of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology 27 th edition pg. 32.

question: Corporo-basal index is useful for determination of
exp: Corporobasal Index = Breadth of first sacral veebra *100/breadth of the base of sacrum Used to determine sex Ref - Narayana Reddy 17th edition page 50 table 4-4. traits diagnostic of Sex

question: Which of the following is the wrong method to cha left lower canine
exp: Palmer's notation Permanent teeth Right left 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 Temporary teeth 5 4 3 2 1 1 2 3 4 5 5 4 3 2 1 1 2 3 4 5 Ref: FORENSIC MEDICINE AND TOXICOLOGY Dr PC IGNATIUS THIRD EDITION PAGE NO 85

question: According to federation dental lower left canine is designated as-
exp: According to FDI, left lower canine is designated as 33. Ref: K. S. Narayan Reddy's synopsis of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology, 29 th edition Chapter4. page no -60

question: Cephalic index of Mongolians is
exp: Cephalic index (Index of Breadth) is Maximum Breadth of Skull / Maximum Length of Skull. From the Cephalic index, race can be determined in 85 - 90% of cases. The skull of an Indian is Caucasian with a few Negroid characters. Type of skull Cephalic index Race Dolicocephalic (long-headed) 70-75 Pure Aryans, Aborigines, Negroes Mesaticephalic (medium-headed) 75-80 Europeans, Chinese, Indians Brachycephalic (sho-headed) 80-85 Mongolian Ref: 1. Dr. Narayana Reddy, The Essentials of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology, 34th edition, pg. 57. 2. V. V. Pillay, Textbook of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology, 18th edition, pg. 70.

question: Rule of Hasse is used to determine -
exp: RULE OF HAASE: This is a rough method of calculating the age of the fetus. The length of the fetus is measured from crown to heel in centimeter During the first 5 months of pregnancy, the square root of the length gives an approximate age of the fetus in months, eg: a fetus length is 16cm is 4 months. HAASE'S MODIFICATION OF MORRISON'S LAW: during the last 5 months, the length in centimeters divided by five gives the age of the fetus in months, eg: fetus of 35cm is 7months. REF: The Synopsis of Forensic Medicine and Toxicology by Dr. K. S. Narayan Reddy 29th edition page no: 51

question: Which of the following is most common fingerprint pattern
exp: The patterns of fingerprints: Loops-these reconstitute 60-70 percent patients encountered Whorl-represent 25-30 percent patients encountered Arch -represent about 5 percent of patients encountered Least commonly encountered is composite Refernce: Essentials of Forensic Medicine and toxicology PG no 2, vol 3
